posts.post_content: More versatility than [Extirpate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Extirpate). Finally bringing a b{i}itch of a black spell to all colors. Posted By: raptorman333 (12/8/2011 8:47:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
While it doesn't have the "split second" that made Extirpate so awesome, it makes up for it with the phyrexian mana cost. I can run this in any color (and boy does my mono-blue control love it). I'm not quite sure why this isn't a 5/5. You get to look at your opponents hand and library for 1 or 2 life, *and* remove a potential threat. I like to goad my opponent into using a mana leak turn two, and then extract the living $#!& out of it. The look on their face is always nice.  
  
TL;DR 5/5.
posts.html:

I'm not quite sure why this isn't a 5/5. You get to look at your opponents hand and library for 1 or 2 life, and remove a potential threat. I like to goad my opponent into using a mana leak turn two, and then extract the living $#!& out of it. The look on their face is always nice.

TL;DR 5/5.

posts.post_content:
This card hoses undying, (yes you can exile [Strangleroot Geist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strangleroot Geist) before he comes back to life) hoses flashback, is an instant for 0 mana. Will be a legacy staple for anti graveyard.  
  
Great card, ive seen it hose my [Curse of Exhaustion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Exhaustion)//[Knowledge Pool](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knowledge Pool) deck.  
  
I prefer it in maindeck imo, because you never know what your going to face. Worst case scenario you get to look at their entire deck, there hand, and ensure there biggest threat in the yard never returns, all at instant speed for 2 life, if that. Hows this not maindeck material? Plus Sorin token decks are polluting MTGO standard right now, and this would deal with allot of things they are packing  
  
If your black and your running Despise, well if you see multiples of a creature or planeswalker, discard it, then you can discard the other for free with this. Just a possible situation I would

Mean people in Vintage will have played all four of theirs by turn three, then drop a [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) and do it again.   
  
One other thing to keep in mind with this card: 75-95% of competitive decks use non-basic lands. This thing can KILL those kinds of decks.

posts.post_content:
You can counter [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction) with another [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction). Your opponent casts [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction) targeting something you want to keep in your deck, let's say your [Mental Misstep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mental Misstep), you cast [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction) in response to theirs targeting your own Mental Misstep, choose to only exile the one that your opponent is targeting and fail to find the rest of them. When your opponent's spell goes to resolve it gets countered since its only target is now an illegal target, saves you from revealing your hand and your entire library. I can see this being a 4 of for every sideboard for a very long time.
  
   
Bye-Bye [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast), Bye-Bye [Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle), and Bye-Bye [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine). For added laughs, mill/discard your opponent's [Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre) and Extract it in response to t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

When your opponent's spell goes to resolve it gets countered since its only target is now an illegal target, saves you from revealing your hand and your entire library. I can see this being a 4 of for every sideboard for a very long time.

posts.post_content:
You can counter this. In fact, if not countering it means losing all your Mana Leaks or Jaces (or Mental Missteps), you might have to. But then you just spent 1 or 2 mana countering a spell which cost its controller 0 mana, giving them time to squeeze out an actual threat.  
  
Control spells that don't cost mana are extremely powerful. Mental Misstep is even more amazing (and is a direct foil to this), but this is still amazing.
posts.html:

Control spells that don't cost mana are extremely powerful. Mental Misstep is even more amazing (and is a direct foil to this), but this is still amazing.

posts.post_content: Much debates between this and [Extirpate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Extirpate), which I really appreciate. But there is [Cremate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cremate) now. What do? I actually like [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction) over extirpate bcs I find myself out of mana more often then facing an opponent with countermagic. But my deck really likes drawing cards instead instead of saving myself one B. Plus, when you side board this in your deck, there is a good chance you also want to draw other useful cards, which this helps you achieve. Any thoughts?

posts.post_content:
Extirpate vs. Surgical Extraction  
Both 5/5  
Extirpate - Split Second  
Surgical Extraction - Phyrexian mana  
At the end I think this is the superior card in most conditions; the only time I believe Extirpate is more powerful is removing cards with "If \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ is put into a graveyard shuffle it back into it's owners library."  
both fantastic and I want a playset (at minimum) of both.
